author: karalabe
content:
Geth 1.10.3 will stop serving `eth/64` per our deprecation policy announced last year https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/745077610685661265/778217548893126666. 

Here's the merged PR: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/22636. Scheduled for release in 2 weeks (though we expect most Berlin nodes to remain on 1.10.1 or .2, keeping eth/64 alive in the network for some more months without too many issues).

author: karalabe
content: We've deliberately waited to release this only post Berlin so there's no urgency for operators to upgrade and no immediate removal of the protocol. from the p2p network

author: karalabe
content: Per said deprecation policy, we're aiming to remove support for `eth/65` this summer. A sanest timing for that would be similar to this one, just after the London hard fork to maximize the lifespan to aid lagging implementations.

author: poojaranjan
content: EIP-3198: BASEFEE opcode is implemented and merged in Besu. Also, Aleut testnet is up and running. To provide  an overview of EIP-3198, we've organized a PEEPanEIP meeting with <@!213672586264051717>.  Join Ethereum Cat Herders (~4 hrs) if you have got something to share about the proposal or any questions.
